Audio Description: The black and white photographs of two young boys in ragged clothing, one of them barefoot, commands the attention of the viewer of this poster. Above them, on the white background, are the words “What can you spare that they can wear?” in large red letters. In a red square next to the smaller boy on the right are the words “Give clothing for war relief” in white letters. In a red square next to the taller boy on the left are the words “April 1 to 30” in white letters. In black letters at the bottom of the poster is written “United National Clothing Collection for Overseas Relief, Henry J. Kaiser, National Chairman.”
Contributors: United States. Office of War Information
Creator: United National Clothing Collection for Overseas War Relief
